snippet: President Obama’s checklist of “lasts” grew longer as he raced through a bone-weary last weekend before Tuesday’s election.
abstract: President Obama’s re-election campaign is now on remote control, with the outcome in the hands of voters less than 24 hours from Election Day; Obama faces the chance, in victory, to secure a legacy as a leader who transformed America; a loss would turn him into an avatar of hope and change who could not fulfill his own promise and whose programs might not survive his remarkable rise and fall.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s checklist of “lasts” grew longer as he raced through a bone-weary last weekend before Tuesday’s election.

headline.seo: Obama Takes Frenetic, Final Campaign Days in Stride
headline.main: A President’s Last Race, Win or Lose
headline.print_headline: His Last Race, Win or Lose
